snippet: On a frigid January morning, Gregory Brandon, who had been unemployed since August, nervously went on a job interview, hoping to call home with good news.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column shares story of Gregory Brandon of Brooklyn, an experienced cook and family man who has been unemployed since August; describes Brandon's experience with a city-run career center, where he was coached before an interview with a national restaurant chain; Brandon was able to call home with good news that he would no longer be on New York City's long list of the jobless.
lead_paragraph: On a frigid January morning, Gregory Brandon, who had been unemployed since August, nervously went on a job interview, hoping to call home with good news.

headline.main: An Unemployed Cook Grasps a Bit of Hope on One of Winter’s Coldest Days
headline.print_headline: An Unemployed Cook Grasps a Bit of Hope on One of Winter’s Coldest Days
